data.title: Celebrating 50 Years of Broadway's Best
data.meta_description: Enjoy a revue of milestone Broadway shows and songs from 1973 to 2023 hosted by two-time Tony Award winner Sutton Foster. Features performances by André De Shields, Chita Rivera, Vanessa Williams and more from Lincoln Center’s David H. Koch Theater.

♪ ♪ Company, lots of company ♪ ♪ Life is company, love is company ♪ ♪ Company ♪ [ Cheers and applause ] [ Cheers and applause continue ] We'll start tonight's celebration when "Great Performances" first premiered in the early 1970s.

Stephen Sondheim's "Company" set the tone and painted a picture of a city of strangers all searching for a connection.

The look and sound of Broadway reflected the changing times, exciting new voices forged that connection and transformed the art form with inventive productions.

Among them, a trailblazing soul spectacular that eased us down the road to Oz; Michael Bennett's prayer for dancers whose lives were on the line; Kander and Ebb's musical vaudeville about a killer chorus girl, her razzle dazzle lawyer, and a scintillating sinner; and Steven Schwartz and Bob Fosse's theatrical tale of a prince trying to find his place in the world.

With some "Magic To Do," please welcome my friend, Grammy and Tony Award winner, Patina Miller.
